wikipedia_page.main: James Nicholl (12 January 1887 – 21 December 1948) was a Scottish footballer who played mainly as an outside left.After breaking into top-level football with Airdrieonians, in 1910 he moved to England with Middlesbrough where he made 56 appearances, scoring 13 goals, before joining Liverpool in January 1914. He played at Anfield for eighteen months, and featured in the 1914 FA Cup Final (having scored both his team's goals to win the semi-final), but his career in England was ended by the outbreak of World War I – he had a short spell back in Scotland with Hamilton Academical.

response: See for instance James Nicholl and James Nicoll. It would be nice to be able to use  without having to worry about the fact the destination disamb contains slight variations, rendering "For other people with the same name" (my emphasis) a falsehood.
* James Nicholl (1890–1955), Scottish footballer with Middlesbrough and Liverpool
